projectPurpose: To provide a powerful and easy-to-learn markup-based typesetting system as a modern alternative to traditional tools like LaTeX and word processors.

alternatives.name: LaTeX
mainFeatures: Ideal for academic and technical documents
Stable and widely used in academia

alternatives.name: Microsoft Word
mainFeatures: Good for simple documents and letters

alternatives.name: Markdown
mainFeatures: Easily convertible to other formats (HTML, PDF)

alternatives.name: ConTeXt
mainFeatures: Comprehensive features built-in (less reliance on external packages)
High level of control over layout and typography
Suitable for complex and structured documents

alternatives.name: Adobe FrameMaker
mainFeatures: Designed for large, complex technical documents
Robust publishing to multiple formats (PDF, HTML, etc.)

alternatives.name: LyX
mainFeatures: Provides access to LaTeX power without direct code writing

marketPositioning: Typst is positioned as a modern, powerful, and user-friendly alternative to traditional typesetting systems like LaTeX and word processors such as Microsoft Word. It targets users who need the power and high-quality output of LaTeX for complex documents (especially in technical and academic fields) but desire a significantly easier learning curve, faster workflow, and more intuitive syntax. It differentiates itself with its integrated scripting, consistent design, rapid compilation with instant previews, and clear error messages, addressing key pain points of LaTeX. Compared to WYSIWYG editors, Typst offers the benefits of a markup approach for structure, consistency, and handling complex elements more effectively.
